ETHICS.Definition: moral rules for deciding what is right and wrong

MORALITY.Definition: a set of standards for deciding what is right and wrong

APPLIED.Definition: if you apply a lesson, you use that lesson

STRATEGIST.Definition: someone with a lot of skill in a particular subject

STICK.Definition: keep doing what you are doing

MISSIONARY.Definition: someone who is sent to a foreign country to teach their religion

CREDITED.Definition: believed to be responsible for (something positive)

BACKSTORY.Definition: things that happened before the main story

FORMATIONS.Definition: (military) how soldiers are divided in different groups

SWEAR BY.Definition: if you swear by something, you believe it is very important

DIPLOMACY.Definition: the job of managing the relationships between countries

LAST RESORT.Definition: if something is a last resort, you do it because there are no other options

HEIGHT.Definition: if something is the height of something else, it's the most extreme example of it

BATTLEFIELD.Definition: the place where a battle is fought

VICTORIOUS.Definition: if you are victorious, you have won (e.g. a battle)

CIRCUMSTANCES.Definition: the conditions that affect a situation

BINGEING.Definition: spending large amounts of time doing

SHADOWING.Definition: an activity used by linguists to improve their speaking

EXPOSE.Definition: if you expose yourself to something, you make it possible to experience it
